tool_description: This API fetches news, market dynamics, price quotations, charts, indices, analyses from investors and specialists, and more.
name: Seeking Alpha API
title: Seeking Alpha API

api_list.name: Screener
api_list.description:
## Screener Endpoint

This endpoint performs screening of financial instruments based on specified criteria. It accepts HTTP GET requests at `/screener`.

### Request Parameters

- `type` (optional, default: 'etf'): The type of financial instruments to be screened. Possible values include 'etf' and 'stock'.

### Request Example

```http
GET /screener?type=stock

api_list.name: Education by Category
api_list.description:
## Education by Category Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves educational resources based on specified categories. It accepts HTTP GET requests at `/education/:categoryNumber`.

### Request Parameters

- `categoryNumber` (required): The number corresponding to the category of educational resources to retrieve. Available categories and their corresponding numbers are:
  - 1: investing
  - 2: portfolio-management
  - 3: etf
  - 4: dividends
  - 5: mutual-funds
  - 6: quant-ratings
  - 7: cryptocurrency
  - 8: 401k
  - 9: ira
- `limit` (optional, default: 40): The maximum number of educational resources to retrieve per page.
- `page` (optional, default: 1): The page number for paginated results.

### Request Example

```http
GET /education/investing?limit=20&page=2

required_parameters.name: categoryNumber
required_parameters.description: must be between 1-9. Check description for more details.

api_list.name: Market Outlook
api_list.description:
## Market Outlook Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves market outlook reports. It accepts HTTP GET requests at `/market-outlook`.

### Request Parameters

- `limit` (optional, default: 40): The maximum number of market outlook reports to retrieve per page.
- `page` (optional, default: 1): The page number for paginated results.

### Request Example

```http
GET /market-outlook?limit=20&page=2

api_list.name: Stock Ideas
api_list.description:
## Stock Ideas Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves stock ideas categorized by industry sectors or types. It accepts HTTP GET requests at `/stock-ideas`.

### Request Parameters

- `categoryNumber` (optional, default: 1): The number corresponding to the category of stock ideas to retrieve. Available categories and their corresponding numbers are:
  - 1: basic-materials
  - 2: consumer-goods
  - 3: financial
  - 4: healthcare
  - 5: industrial-goods
  - 6: ipos
  - 7: long-ideas
  - 8: quick-picks
  - 9: technology
  - 10: utilities
- `limit` (optional, default: 40): The maximum number of stock ideas to retrieve per page.
- `page` (optional, default: 1): The page number for paginated results.

### Request Example

```http
GET /stock-ideas?categoryNumber=4&limit=20&page=2

optional_parameters.name: categoryNumber
optional_parameters.description: Check the description for more options

api_list.name: Podcast
api_list.description:
## Podcast Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves podcast episodes. It accepts HTTP GET requests at `/podcast`.

### Request Parameters

- `limit` (optional, default: 40): The maximum number of podcast episodes to retrieve per page.
- `page` (optional, default: 1): The page number for paginated results.

### Request Example

```http
GET /podcast?limit=20&page=2

api_list.name: Education
api_list.description:
## Education All Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves educational resources. It accepts HTTP GET requests at `/education`.

### Request Parameters

- `limit` (optional, default: 40): The maximum number of educational resources to retrieve per page.
- `page` (optional, default: 1): The page number for paginated results.

### Request Example

```http
GET /education?limit=20&page=2

api_list.name: Comparison
api_list.description:
## Comparison Results Endpoint

This endpoint compares financial instruments based on predefined options. It accepts HTTP GET requests at `/comparison`.

### Request Parameters

- `option` (optional): The selected option for comparison. Each option corresponds to a set of financial instruments. Possible values include:
  - 1: 9e-FAANG-Stocks
  - 2: 9679-Gold-ETFs
  - 3: 95bd-Cash-Equivalents
  - 4: 9678-Big-Bank-Stocks
  - 5: 967b-Big-Pharma-Stocks
  - 6: 967a-Retail-Stocks

### Request Example

```http
GET /comparison?option=2

required_parameters.name: option
required_parameters.description: check the list in the description.

api_list.name: Screener Result
api_list.description:
## Screener Results Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves the results of screening financial instruments based on specified criteria. It accepts HTTP GET requests at `/screener-result`.

### Request Parameters

- `type` (optional, default: 'stock'): The type of financial instruments for which results are to be retrieved. Possible values include 'etf' and 'stock'.
- `page` (optional, default: 1): The page number for paginated results.
- `per_page` (optional, default: 100): The number of results per page.

### Request Example

```http
GET /screener-result?type=etf&page=2&per_page=50

api_list.name: Screener Filter
api_list.description:
## Screener Filter Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves filters for screening financial instruments. It accepts HTTP GET requests at `/screener-filter`.

### Request Parameters

- `type` (optional, default: 'etf'): The type of financial instruments for which filters are to be retrieved. Possible values include 'etf' and 'stock'.

### Request Example

```http
GET /screener-filter?type=stock

api_list.name: Metrics Grades
api_list.description:
## Metrics Grades Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves grades for specific financial metrics associated with given financial instruments. It accepts HTTP GET requests at `/metrics-grades`.

### Request Parameters

- `slugs` (optional, default: 'fnma,nlcp,gm,intr,axahy,desp,hmc,pags,mfc,lmb,gbdc,ezpw,blbd,stne,rdcm,fro,tnk,bap,parr,htgc,asc,vygr,vtgn,cnc,hiti,kof,timb,ssrey,vtsi,cx,expe,dnow,slvm,viv,arco'): The slugs of the financial instruments for which metrics grades are to be retrieved. Slugs must be separated by commas.

### Request Example

```http
GET /metrics-grades?slugs=fnma,nlcp,gm

api_list.name: Analyst Recommendation
api_list.description:
## Analyst Recommendation Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves the level of analyst recommendation for specific financial instruments. It accepts HTTP GET requests at `/analyst-recommendation`.

### Request Parameters

- `slugs` (optional, default: 'SPY,DIA,QQQ,MDY,IJR,IWC'): The slugs of the financial instruments for which analyst recommendations are to be retrieved. Slugs must be separated by commas.

### Request Example

```http
GET /analyst-recommendation?slugs=SPY,DIA,QQQ

optional_parameters.name: slugs
optional_parameters.description: if it's more than one, separate them by comma. i.e: 'SPY, DIA'

api_list.name: Metrics
api_list.description:
## Metrics Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves metrics for specific financial instruments. It accepts HTTP GET requests at `/metrics`.

### Request Parameters

- `slugs` (optional, default: 'SPY,DIA,QQQ,MDY,IJR,IWC'): The slugs of the financial instruments for which metrics are to be retrieved. Slugs must be separated by commas.

### Request Example

```http
GET /metrics?slugs=SPY,DIA,QQQ

api_list.name: Articles
api_list.description:
## Articles Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves articles based on specified parameters. It accepts HTTP GET requests at `/articles`.

| Parameter | Description                                  | Possible Values                              | Default Value |
|-----------|----------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------|---------------|
| category  | The category of articles to retrieve.       | notable-calls-insights, biotech-stocks, buybacks, commodities, consumer, crypto, issuance, dividend-funds, dividend-stocks, earnings, energy, financials, global, graphical-news, guidance, healthcare, ipos, m-a, market-pulse, mlps, notable-calls, on-the-move, politics, reits, spacs, technology, top-news, us-economy, trending, all | all           |
| limit     | The maximum number of articles per page.    | Integer                                      | 10            |
| page      | The page number for paginated results.      | Integer                                      | 1             |

api_list.name: Editor Best Pick (Article)
api_list.description:
## Article Editor Picker Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves a list of article editors. It accepts HTTP GET requests at `/article-editor`.

### Request Parameters

- `limit` (optional, default: '10'): The maximum number of editors to retrieve.

### Request Example

```http
GET /article-editor?limit=5

api_list.name: Chart
api_list.description:
## Stock Chart Endpoint

This endpoint generates a stock chart graphic based on the provided parameters. It accepts HTTP GET requests at `/chart`.

### Request Parameters

- `period` (optional, default: '1D'): The time period for the stock chart. Possible values include '1D' (1 day), '1W' (1 week), '1M' (1 month), etc.
- `ticker_id`: The ID of the stock for which the chart is to be generated.

### Request Example

```http
GET /chart?period=1W&ticker_id=ABC

api_list.name: Dividend Investing
api_list.description:
## Dividend Investing Endpoint

This endpoint provides information on dividend investing. It accepts HTTP GET requests at `/dividend-investing`.

### Request

This endpoint does not require any request parameters.

### Request Example

```http
GET /dividend-investing
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://seeking-alpha-api.p.rapidapi.com/dividend-investing"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "seeking-alpha-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://seeking-alpha-api.p.rapidapi.com/dividend-investing"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "seeking-alpha-api.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: stock Price
api_list.description:
## Stock Price Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves the price of a specific stock. It accepts HTTP GET requests at `/price`.

### Request Parameters

- `sa_id`: The ID of the stock for which the price is to be retrieved.

### Request Example

```http
GET /price?sa_id=XYZ123

api_list.name: Recommendation
api_list.description:
## Recommendation Endpoint

This endpoint retrieves recommended quotes. It accepts HTTP GET requests at `/recommendation`.

### Request

This endpoint does not require any request parameters.

        }

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Search
api_list.description:
## Search Endpoint

This endpoint allows users to search for items based on a query string. It accepts HTTP GET requests at `/search`.

### Request Parameters

- `query`: The search query string.
- `limit` (optional, default: 40): The maximum number of items to return per page.
- `page` (optional, default: 1): The page number for paginated results.
